quoridor.model

Class MoveCalculator

  • java.lang.Object
    • quoridor.model.MoveCalculator

  • public class MoveCalculator
extends java.lang.Object
    MoveCalculator class. Contains all the useful methods of the game that manage the players moves, by determining if they are legal. This class contains the browsing algorithm which ensure that moves fit the game's rules.

      • updatePossibleWalls

        private void updatePossibleWalls()
        Updates the possibleWalls ArrayList, used by both players, by browsing through all the grid coordinates to check each possible wall to put on the grid.

      • isLegalWall

        public boolean isLegalWall(int x,
                           int y)
        Browses through the possibleWalls ArrayList corresponding to the given player, to check if the wall move with the given coordinates is in it, which means that placing this wall is possible.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of the wall move
        y - the y-coordinate of the wall move
        Returns:
        true is the wall move is possible, false otherwise

      • isLegalPawn

        public boolean isLegalPawn(int x,
                           int y,
                           Player player)
        Browses through the possibleMoves ArrayList corresponding to the given player, to check if the move with the given coordinates is in it, which means that the move is possible.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of the move
        y - the y-coordinate of the move
        player - the player that made the move
        Returns:
        true is the move is possible, false otherwise

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • checkMove

        private boolean checkMove(int x,
                          int y,
                          Player player)
        Checks if the given move respects the game rules and can be placed. This method contains the algorithm that checks the grid to determines if the move fit the rules.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of the move
        y - the y-coordinate of the move
        player - the player that made the move
        Returns:
        false if there is no move possible
